The cause of cirrhosis was defined on the basis of the presence of diagnostic codes and laboratory results during either the run-in period or follow-up time (eTable 1 in the Supplement). For those with viral hepatitis and another cause (eg, alcohol), the cause was considered to be viral hepatitis. Patients with alcohol and another nonviral cause were considered to have alcohol-induced cirrhosis. Where available, validated coding algorithms were used.
18, 19 Patients without 1 of the listed diagnoses were considered to have NASH or another cause of liver disease.
